item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 1:05 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Microsoft donates the Mono Project to the Wine team (749 points | 235 comments)
2. Faster CRDTs (2021) (167 points | 42 comments)
3. A Collection of Free Public APIs That Is Tested Daily (233 points | 49 comments)
4. The Monospace Web (203 points | 44 comments)
5. Sainsbury Wing contractors find 1990 letter from donor (254 points | 63 comments)
6. Blitzortung – real time lightning strikes around the world (152 points | 53 comments)
7. Taskwarrior – CLI Task Management (63 points | 23 comments)
8. KLEE Symbolic Execution Engine (43 points | 6 comments)
9. If Your World Is Not Enchanted, You're Not Paying Attention (39 points | 25 comments)
10. Vulnerabilities show why STARTTLS should be avoided if possible (2021) (66 points | 35 comments)
11. DisTrO – a family of low latency distributed optimizers (60 points | 21 comments)
12. How Chrome Accessibility Works (33 points | 9 comments)
13. ChartDB – Free and open source, database design editor (11 points | 1 comment)
14. EasyPost (YC S13) Is Hiring ( | hide)
15. Slime mold simulation in Rust using WASM and WebGPU (16 points | 3 comments)
16. The Simple Algorithm That Ants Use to Build Bridges (2018) (50 points | 10 comments)
17. Launch HN: Bucket Robotics (YC S24) – Defect detection for molded and cast parts (75 points | 19 comments)
18. Rustproofing Linux (Part 1/4 Leaking Addresses) (2023) (57 points | 8 comments)
19. Knockknock: Simple, secure, and stealthy port knocking implementation (7 points | 3 comments)
20. Anthropic publishes the 'system prompts' that make Claude tick (345 points | 216 comments)
21. PyRoboCOP: Python-Based Robotic Control and Optimization Package (18 points | discuss)
22. Splatt3R: Zero-Shot Gaussian Splatting from Uncalibrated Image Pairs (116 points | 24 comments)
23. A New Wave of Underwater Comms Is Coming (44 points | 17 comments)
24. Malware infiltrates Pidgin messenger's official plugin repository (133 points | 12 comments)
25. Zuckerberg claims regret on caving to White House pressure on content (451 points | 825 comments)
26. After a decade of free Alexa, Amazon now wants you to pay (24 points | 19 comments)
27. Microsoft security tools questioned for treating employees as threats (55 points | 8 comments)
28. U.S. Ambassador says Canadians are consuming 'unhealthy' amount of American news (193 points | 236 comments)
29. Hackers infect ISPs with malware that steals customers' credentials (31 points | 11 comments)
30. Clay (short for C Layout) is a high performance 2D UI layout library (185 points | 80 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, August 28, 2024 at 1:05 AM UTC
